item.title: Blockchain Implementations: Who Are You Going to Call? - CoinDesk
item.description:
Blockchain Implementations: Who Are You Going to Call? - CoinDesk

William Mougayar is a Toronto-based entrepreneur, investor and advisor to Consensus 2016, CoinDesk's flagship conference. He is also the author of the upcoming book, In this opinion piece, Mougayar segments the blockchain startup scene, breaking down the available platforms and tech providers, and their offerings. The Business Blockchain .

item.title: Coinsource Expands its Bitcoin ATM Network Across West Coast - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Coinsource Expands its Bitcoin ATM Network Across West Coast - NEWSBTC

The number of Bitcoin ATMs in the 'City of Angels' has gone up. Coinsource, the Bitcoin ATM network has announced that it has added seven new Bitcoin ATMs to its network in Los Angeles recently. At the same time, Las Vegas received 2 more of these machines.

item.title: Kraken to supply pricing data for CME Group's new bitcoin indices
item.description:
Kraken to supply pricing data for CME Group's new bitcoin indices

Bitcoin and digital assets exchange Kraken has been selected to be a key supplier of market data for real-time and reference bitcoin price indices by CME Group. According to a press release sent to...

item.title: Factom Technical Analysis for 05/04/2016 - Plenty of Pivot Zones on the Charts
item.description:
Factom Technical Analysis for 05/04/2016 - Plenty of Pivot Zones on the Charts

The pivot zone at 0.00255 is continuing to influence the price action on the Factom charts. Since my last article - where I first outlined this pivot zone for the first time - the 0.00255 area has acted as resistance an additional four times, and also twice as support.

item.title: Brexit May Spell Doom for Fintech and Bitcoin. In the UK, That Is
item.description:
Brexit May Spell Doom for Fintech and Bitcoin. In the UK, That Is

What impact Britain's exit from the European Union will have on Bitcoin and Fintech? The British have always seen themselves as a bit distinct from their European cousins across the Channel. Indeed, Britain is probably more similar to Canada, Australia, New Zealand and even the United States than what lies 20 miles away in Europe.

item.title: Educating Regulators a Priority, Say Blockchain Policy Experts - CoinDesk
item.description:
Educating Regulators a Priority, Say Blockchain Policy Experts - CoinDesk

If digital currency is ever going to go mainstream, regulators will need to remove the doubt that surrounds it. But before that happens they need to understand the technology.

item.title: Gavin Andersen: It Was a Mistake to Blog Claiming Craig Wright Is Satoshi
item.description:
Gavin Andersen: It Was a Mistake to Blog Claiming Craig Wright Is Satoshi

Bitcoin core developer Gavin Andersen has expressed regret in publishing his blog backing Craig Wright's claim that he is, Satoshi Nakamoto. More specifically, Andersen claims it was a mistake to publish his post before the much-scrutinized post published by Craig Wright.

item.title: The Bitcoin Future is Bright
item.description:
The Bitcoin Future is Bright

A review of the exciting ways that Bitcoin will change our financial transactions and how we view money in the future. What fascinates many people is not what Bitcoin is today. Instead, the future possibilities of Bitcoin are seriously validating the idea of crypto-currencies eventually coming into the mainstream, alongside fiat currencies.

item.title: Gift Off Noted US$290k Monthly Turnover In Bitcoin - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Gift Off Noted US$290k Monthly Turnover In Bitcoin - Bitcoinist.net

Bitcoin is a booming business in the United Kingdom, assuming one knows how to play their cards right. Gift Off, a company specializing in selling gift cards for Bitcoin, recorded an all-time high turnover in February of 2016.

item.title: Social Blogging Platform AKASHA Nears Public Alpha Release
item.description:
Social Blogging Platform AKASHA Nears Public Alpha Release

Censorship has plagued social media platforms for several years, and AKASHA wants to put an end to this scenario. This "next-generation" social media network is powered by the Ethereum world computer and the Inter-Planetary File System (IPFS). Also read: TRI to Finally Ship Turing Phone This May That will be the main question to answer in the next few years.
